issue.body:
### Is your task related to a problem? Please describe

Logger class should sent data into test steps to reportportal and attach screenshots on test failed.
![image](https://github.com/eclipse/che/assets/72726250/ace896bc-dbc2-46da-991c-937e76dfb889)


### Describe the solution you'd like

Update Logger class with to send logs using publicReportingAPI.js
Update MochaHooks.ts to create and send attachment on test fail.
https://github.com/reportportal/agent-js-mocha/tree/develop

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

pull_request.title: feat: Add logging with attachments into ReportPortal
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please review the following before submitting a PR:
Che's Contributing Guide: https://github.com/eclipse/che/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
Pull Request Policy: https://github.com/eclipse/che/wiki/Development-Workflow#pull-requests
-->

### What does this PR do?
- PR updates Logger class to send logs into report-portal service using external API.
- Added method which will send attachment on test fail

### Screenshot/screencast of this PR
<!-- Please include a screenshot or a screencast explaining what is doing this PR -->
![image](https://github.com/eclipse/che/assets/72726250/f6238c5a-6187-49ee-ae7c-bba2d0f97a3d)


### What issues does this PR fix or reference?
<!-- Please include any related issue from eclipse che repository (or from another issue tracker).
     Include link to other pull requests like documentation PR from [the docs repo](https://github.com/eclipse/che-docs)
-->
#22586 

### How to test this PR?
<!-- Please explain for example :
  - The test platform (openshift, kubernetes, minikube, CodeReady Container, docker-desktop, etc)
  - Installation method: chectl / che-operator
  - steps to reproduce
 -->
set SAVE_RP_REPORT_DATA=true, fill relevant reporter constants to set server and user for saving the report. Run some tests.

### PR Checklist

[As the author of this Pull Request I made sure that:](https://github.com/eclipse/che/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-template-and-its-checklist)

issue.body: While tests were not running, run script on package.json become broken because of a lot of test framework updates. It should be fixed.

Signed-off-by: mdolhalo <mdolhalo@redhat.com>

issue.title: Generate E2E typescript test report for ReportPortal

labels.name: kind/task
labels.description: Internal things, technical debt, and to-do tasks to be performed.

labels.name: severity/P1
labels.description: Has a major impact to usage or development of the system.

labels.name: team/B

issue.body:
### Is your task related to a problem? Please describe

Make it possible to generate test report for ReportPortal https://reportportal-crw.apps.ocp-c1.prod.psi.redhat.com

### Describe the solution you'd like

Use [@reportportal/agent-js-mocha](https://github.com/reportportal/agent-js-mocha#readme) library.

[Reporter option](https://github.com/reportportal/agent-js-mocha#reportportalagent-js-mocha):
```
const mochaMain = new Mocha({
  reporter: '@reportportal/agent-js-mocha',
  reporterOptions: {
    endpoint: 'https://reportportal-crw.apps.ocp-c1.prod.psi.redhat.com/api/v1',
    token: 'RP_TOKEN',
    launch: 'RP_LAUNCH_NAME',
    project: 'RP_PROJECT_NAME',
    description: 'RP_LAUNCH_DESCRIPTION'
  },
  timeout: 250000
});
```
There are dedicated projects:
- project for **devspaces** test reports: https://reportportal-crw.apps.ocp-c1.prod.psi.redhat.com/ui/#devspaces/dashboard
- project for **che** test reports: https://reportportal-crw.apps.ocp-c1.prod.psi.redhat.com/ui/#che/dashboard

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

Downstream issue: https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CRW-1433

commits.message:
Generate E2E typescript test report for ReportPortal (#22590)

feat: reportportal integration

Signed-off-by: mdolhalo <mdolhalo@redhat.com>

pull_request.title: Generate E2E typescript test report for ReportPortal
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please review the following before submitting a PR:
Che's Contributing Guide: https://github.com/eclipse/che/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
Pull Request Policy: https://github.com/eclipse/che/wiki/Development-Workflow#pull-requests
-->

### What does this PR do?
resolves #22543 

### Screenshot/screencast of this PR
<!-- Please include a screenshot or a screencast explaining what is doing this PR -->
https://reportportal-crw.apps.ocp-c1.prod.psi.redhat.com/ui/#devspaces/launches/all

### What issues does this PR fix or reference?
<!-- Please include any related issue from eclipse che repository (or from another issue tracker).
     Include link to other pull requests like documentation PR from [the docs repo](https://github.com/eclipse/che-docs)
-->
resolves #22543 

### How to test this PR?
<!-- Please explain for example :
  - The test platform (openshift, kubernetes, minikube, CodeReady Container, docker-desktop, etc)
  - Installation method: chectl / che-operator
  - steps to reproduce
 -->
Use `REPORTER_CONSTANTS` to set reporter parameters 
Then run tests, for example using `tests/e2e/configs/sh-scripts/regressionTestRun.sh`

### PR Checklist

[As the author of this Pull Request I made sure that:](https://github.com/eclipse/che/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-template-and-its-checklist)

issue.title: Add dependent projects supports in VS Code launcher

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: A feature request - must adhere to the feature request template.

labels.name: severity/P1
labels.description: Has a major impact to usage or development of the system.

labels.name: area/editor/vscode
labels.description: Issues related to the Code OSS editor of Che

issue.body:
### Is your enhancement related to a problem? Please describe

We recently added [`dependentProjects`](https://github.com/devfile/api/issues/1082) in the devfile spec. But VS Code launcher only looks at [projects](https://github.com/che-incubator/che-code/blob/main/launcher/src/code-workspace.ts#L60) and won't include those in the `vscode-workspace` file.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Launcher should add `dependentProjects` too.

comment.body: Yes, dependentProjects will land in devfile 2.2.2, and DWO v0.24 is built off devfile 2.2.1. We can accelerate the process by depending on a non-tagged version of devfile/api and pull changes in quicker, however -- it depends on priority for dependentProjects and devfile/api's release cadence (which if past releases are an indicator, could be a long time)

issue.title: After revoking Che authorization for gitlab.com I cannot authenticate anymore

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Outline of a bug - must adhere to the bug report template.

labels.name: severity/P1
labels.description: Has a major impact to usage or development of the system.

issue.body: ### Describe the bug After revoking Che authorization in gitlab.com `User Settings > Applications > Authorized Applications`, trying to clone a **private** GitLab repository fails permanently. ### Che version nightly (dogfooding) ### Steps to reproduce - Login to a Che instance configured with OAuth for gitlab.com (for example che dogfooding) - Start a workspace from a private gitlab.com repository - When asked, authorize the Che instance to use your gitlab.com account - Observe that the workspace is created successfully and that the source code is cloned successfully - Delete the workspace - Go in gitlab.com `User Settings > Applications > Authorized Applications` and revoke the authorization to Che application - Start a new workspace from a private gitlab.com repository (the same or another) - Observe that the workspace is started but 1) defvile is not found 2) source code is not cloned ### Expected behavior I would expect that, after revoking the authorization, when starting a new workspace from a gitlab.com private repository I would have been asked again to authorize Che and that the workspace would start successfully (devfile found and sources cloned). ### Runtime OpenShift ### Screenshots ### Installation method chectl/next ### Environment Amazon ### Eclipse Che Logs _No response_ ### Additional context _No response_

comment.body: I was not able to reproduce the problem on GitHub and Azure DevOps

issue.title: After revoking Che authorization for gitlab.com I cannot authenticate anymore

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Outline of a bug - must adhere to the bug report template.

labels.name: severity/P1
labels.description: Has a major impact to usage or development of the system.

issue.body: ### Describe the bug After revoking Che authorization in gitlab.com `User Settings > Applications > Authorized Applications`, trying to clone a **private** GitLab repository fails permanently. ### Che version nightly (dogfooding) ### Steps to reproduce - Login to a Che instance configured with OAuth for gitlab.com (for example che dogfooding) - Start a workspace from a private gitlab.com repository - When asked, authorize the Che instance to use your gitlab.com account - Observe that the workspace is created successfully and that the source code is cloned successfully - Delete the workspace - Go in gitlab.com `User Settings > Applications > Authorized Applications` and revoke the authorization to Che application - Start a new workspace from a private gitlab.com repository (the same or another) - Observe that the workspace is started but 1) defvile is not found 2) source code is not cloned ### Expected behavior I would expect that, after revoking the authorization, when starting a new workspace from a gitlab.com private repository I would have been asked again to authorize Che and that the workspace would start successfully (devfile found and sources cloned). ### Runtime OpenShift ### Screenshots ### Installation method chectl/next ### Environment Amazon ### Eclipse Che Logs _No response_ ### Additional context _No response_

comment.body:
This looks related to the fact that che-server is somehow caching the git tokens. Even if I revoke the authorization from gitlab.com and if I delete the secrets from my namespace, GitLab still shows up in the Git services tab and che-server never redirects me to the Authorization page.

Related to https://github.com/eclipse/che/issues/22631

issue.title: "Error: Loading CSS chunk 469 failed." in Dashboard after OCP auth session is expired

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Outline of a bug - must adhere to the bug report template.

labels.name: severity/P1
labels.description: Has a major impact to usage or development of the system.

labels.name: team/A
labels.description: This team is responsible for the Che Operator and all its operands as well as chectl and Hosted Che

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Dashboard of Eclipse Che Next has shown error "Loading CSS chunk 469 failed." after OCP auth session is expired:
```
Error: Loading CSS chunk 469 failed. (https://eclipse-che.apps.ocp410.crw-qe.com/dashboard/469.dfe56f9999e93c8993d4.css)

    in Unknown
    in t
    in t
    in RoutesComponent
    in Suspense
    in kt
    in main
    in div
    in Page
    in Dt
    in Connect(Dt)
    in t
    in c
    in i
    in Connect(i)
    in AppComponent
    in u
```

### Che version

next (development version)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Deploy Eclipse Che Next (7.68.0-SNAPSHOT) to OCP.
2. Go to Eclipse Che Dashboard.
3. Switch to another browser tab till auth session is expired.
4. Return to browser tab with Eclipse Che Dashboard and go to Workspaces page.

### Expected behavior

Workspaces page is opened

### Runtime

OpenShift

### Screenshots

![Screenshot from 2023-05-23 16-27-02](https://github.com/eclipse/che/assets/1197777/366c8c4e-396e-4103-bb85-4b39da0f3f82)


### Installation method

chectl/next

### Environment

Linux

### Eclipse Che Logs

_No response_

### Additional context

There is workaround: refresh the browser page with Eclipse Che Dashboard.

issue.title: Not all Git Services are shown in user preferences

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Outline of a bug - must adhere to the bug report template.

labels.name: severity/P1
labels.description: Has a major impact to usage or development of the system.

issue.body: ### Describe the bug I have setup 3 git services (GitHub, GitLab and AzureDevops): ```bash $ kubectl get secrets -l "controller.devfile.io/git-credential=true" -o json | \ jq '.items[].metadata.annotations' | grep "che.eclipse.org/scm-url" "che.eclipse.org/scm-url": "https://gitlab.com", "che.eclipse.org/scm-url": "https://github.com", "che.eclipse.org/scm-url": "https://dev.azure.com", ``` But on dashboard I only see GitLab: ### Che version next (development version) ### Steps to reproduce On dogfooding instance I have started workspaces from the different: - azure devops (for example https://marioloriedo@dev.azure.com/marioloriedo/publicproject/_git/public-repo) - gitlab (for example https://gitlab.com/mario.loriedo/microservices-demo-frontend) - github And Che setup successfully the git credential secret for all. But on Dashboard user preferences I can only see GitLab. ### Expected behavior I would like to see all the git services ### Runtime OpenShift ### Screenshots _No response_ ### Installation method OperatorHub ### Environment Amazon ### Eclipse Che Logs _No response_ ### Additional context _No response_

comment.body: Refreshing or using incognito doesn't help. I have added che-server label as dashboard gets the list from che-server that probably keep these info in cache (and if it's restarted lose them).

issue.title: Eclipse Che with Keycloak on GKE

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Outline of a bug - must adhere to the bug report template.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Hello
I`m trying to deploy Eclipse Che on GKE 
Initial setup was successful but  after login to the dashboard I got:
```
Failed to fetch available workspaces, reason: Failed to fetch the list of devWorkspaces. Unable to list devworkspaces: Unauthorized
Danger alert:Failed to fetch the user profile data. Unable to get user profile data: Unauthorized
```

After some investigation, I could see strange behavior of gke-oidc-service:
```
Envoy adapter received a new request from 10.1.1.17
Handling GET request for https://gke-oidc-envoy.anthos-identity-service/api/v1/namespaces
Stopping OIDC authentication for https://keycloak.xxxxxx.xx/realms/master. Unable to verify the OIDC ID token: Token's audiences "https://container.googleapis.com/v1/projects/xxxxxxxxx/locations/xxxxxxxx/clusters/xxxxx" do not match; allowed: "kubernetes"
```
I could not figure out where I have broken behavior in the line of Che -> Keycoal -> GCP Identity Service.
My  patch for  Che:
```
kind: CheCluster
apiVersion: org.eclipse.che/v2
metadata:
    name: eclipse-che
    namespace: eclipse-che
spec:
  networking:
    domain: "che.xxxxxx.xxx"
    auth:
      oAuthClientName: "kubernetes"
      oAuthSecret: "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
      identityProviderURL: "https://keycloak.xxxxxx.xx/realms/master"
  components:
    cheServer:
      extraProperties:
        CHE_OIDC_USERNAME__CLAIM: email
        CHE_INFRA_KUBERNETES_MASTER__URL: "https://gke-oidc-envoy.anthos-identity-service"
        CHE_INFRA_KUBERNETES_PORT: "tcp://10.0.0.34:443"
        CHE_INFRA_KUBERNETES_PORT_443_TCP_ADDR: "10.0.0.34"
        CHE_INFRA_KUBERNETES_PORT_443_TCP: "tcp://10.0.0.34:443"
        CHE_INFRA_KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST: "10.0.0.34" 
```
Configuration for Identity Service:
```
 authentication:
  - name: oidc
    oidc:
      clientID: kubernetes
      clientSecret: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
      groupsClaim: groups
      issuerURI: https://keycloak.xxxxxx.xx/realms/master
      kubectlRedirectURI: http://localhost:10000/callback
      scopes: openid profile email
      userClaim: email

### Che version

7.75@latest

### Steps to reproduce

Install Che with:

chectl server:deploy --installer operator --domain=che.xxxxxx.xx --platform=k8s --che-operator-cr-patch-yaml=./che-patch.yaml --telemetry=off --skip-cert-manager -n default 


### Expected behavior

Dashboard could authenticate to kube-api

### Runtime

other (please specify in additional context)

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Installation method

chectl/latest

### Environment

GCE

### Eclipse Che Logs

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: Add dependent projects supports in VS Code launcher

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: A feature request - must adhere to the feature request template.

labels.name: severity/P1
labels.description: Has a major impact to usage or development of the system.

labels.name: area/editor/vscode
labels.description: Issues related to the Code OSS editor of Che

issue.body:
### Is your enhancement related to a problem? Please describe

We recently added [`dependentProjects`](https://github.com/devfile/api/issues/1082) in the devfile spec. But VS Code launcher only looks at [projects](https://github.com/che-incubator/che-code/blob/main/launcher/src/code-workspace.ts#L60) and won't include those in the `vscode-workspace` file.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Launcher should add `dependentProjects` too.

comment.body: Ok so even devworkspace next is not including that right? And it's not included in 2.2.1 but we need a 2.2.2?

issue.title: VS Code launcher should update the projects in vscode-workspace at restart

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: A feature request - must adhere to the feature request template.

issue.body:
### Is your enhancement related to a problem? Please describe

Currently VS Code launcher is adding projects from the devfile only when the {{.vscode-workspace}} file doesn't exist. So it does that only at startup. 

The problem is that if a user starts a workspace, adds a new project (or dependent project) in the devfile.yaml and select "restart from local devfile", then the new project is not included in the existing {{.vscode-workspace}} file and the user won't see it in vs code (although it has been cloned).

### Describe the solution you'd like

We should update an existing `vscode-workspace` file even, if it has been created automatically by the launcher, and if the projects have changed.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_
